job_title: Senior Sales Executive - Maine/New Hampshire (state residency req'd)
job_description:
Senior Sales Executive – Maine/New Hampshire (state residency required)

At Ockers, our mission is to continue expanding the array of services we provide to help our national client base to help them keep pace with the latest advances in technology. Ockers proudly serves a diverse customer base that includes educational and government markets, major corporations, municipalities, and small to medium-sized businesses within a wide spectrum of industries.

Ockers has been in business for 102 years, with seven different client-based divisions. While our core client base is K through 12 schools, we also provide next generation technology solutions for police, fire, and emergency response groups, cities and towns, and a variety of private and public private businesses. We currently employ over 110 people and are looking to exceed $50M in revenue in 2024.

The Senior Sales Executive assigned to this region is responsible for driving profitable revenue growth. The right candidate must have remote sales experience, be proficient with reseller programs, promotions, forecasting, pricing, and P&L. The company is seeking someone who has a very strong track record of achieving targets and objectives. An individual who is highly effective and successful in sales lead generation, negotiations, and closing who also has a passion for education technology adoption would be ideal.

Responsibilities

· Identify and establish contact with potential customers

· Drive profitable revenue growth

· Build and maintain a network of sources from which to identify new sales leads

· Meet or exceed quarterly jointly agreed revenue and gross margin targets

· Develop and execute regional sales initiatives to support growth goals

· Ensure customer satisfaction through ongoing communication and relationship management; resolves any issues that may arise post-sale

· Schedule and perform product demonstrations with prospective customers

· Routinely communicate with customers and leads to identify and understand their product or service needs; identifies and suggests products and services to meet those requirements

· Monthly/Quarterly progress reporting to management

· Follow industry trends to identify new opportunities for potential sales

· Must be willing to make cold calls, search for sales leads, and identify possible clients

· Maintain communication with existing and previous customers, alerting them of new products, services, and enhancements that may be of interest

· Deliver on-site and remote training to clients

· Attend industry trade shows to identify potential sales leads and make meaningful contact with existing customers

· Actively participate in regional industry associations and related activities

o Planning for, managing and staffing all sales promotion activities, including trade shows, seminars, training classes, and customer-driven activities. Attendance and participation in local, regional, and national meetings.

· Recommend marketing strategies to target a specific region or demographic

· Assist clients with technical support issues until a resolution is achieved

· Create and deliver detailed reports of sales activities including calls, orders, sales, lost business, and any customer or vendor relationship problems

· Provide territory sales forecasts and pipelines

· Willing to travel to client locations and also travel to internal quarterly sales meetings

· SELL!

· Perform other duties as requested

Required Skills and Experience

· Must reside within a 15-minute commute of either I-91 or I-95 in Maine or New Hampshire

· BS/BA degree preferred, preferably in Business Administration, Management, Sales, or other related field

· Aggressive, determined, and successful salesperson who will call on, and pursue, new prospects

· 5+ years of experience in channel management, account management, sales management key account management or similar experience

· Must be a self-starter

· Required to be a Maine or New Hampshire resident

· Ability to routinely travel throughout the states of Maine and New Hampshire

· Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and related software

· Excellent oral and written communication skills

· Able to excel without daily oversight and supervision

· Phenomenal listening, negotiation, and presentation abilities

· Attend quarterly Sales meetings at corporate headquarters in Middleboro, MA

· Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities

· Outstanding organizational skills and superior attention to detail

· Persistent, tenacious, and tremendous negotiating qualifications

· Technically savvy

· Fantastic interpersonal and customer service capabilities

Ockers is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristics. Ockers is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
